result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angela M Zavala in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF32, 15CF121 (Sentencing Hearing), 15CF210 (Status), 15CF335 (Prelim)

Atty Cousins makes statements. 
Atty Kryshak makes statements.  State has been relieved of its plea offer. 
  
15CF210 & 15CF335: 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Informations. 
Atty Kryshak has received copies of the informations and waives their readings. 
NOT GUILTY Pleas are entered. 

Court notes the above files have been recommended to be dismissed and read-in. 

15CF32, 15CF121: 
Court and both counsel have received the PSI and the addendum. 
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF32 Count 3 - 
3 years prison with 1 year 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 1 year 6 months Extended Supervision - STAYED -
Terms of Extended Supervision are the same as probation: 
Placed on probation for a period 3 years: 
15CF32 conditions:  
Serve 200 days in jail.  
14 days credit. 
First 100 days in jail with second 100 days on Home detention/electronic monitor if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration.
Huber for employment and any counseling she might be involved in (on both halves).
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All medications from 1 pharmacy. 
Sign all release forms so agent can monitor compliance with conditions. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Comply with any other assessments or treatment or programming recommended by DOC. 
Provide list of all medications she is being prescribed.
No contact with anyone associated with the use of illegal drugs. 
Any contact with Jeremy Walber must be approved by her agent. 
Obtain fulltime employment or school fulltime or combination thereof. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF121-
3 years prison with 1 year 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 1 year 6 months Extended Supervision, concurrent with 15CF32 -STAYED -
Placed on probation for a period 3 years: 
Serve 200 days in jail.  
14 days credit. 
First 100 days in jail with second 100 days on Home detention/electronic monitor if approved by RISK assessment and jail administ
Huber for employment and any counseling she might be involved in (on both halves)
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF32.  
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse programs. 
Court advises post-conviction. 

BY THE COURT: 
15TR2206 is dismissed.
15CF210 & 15CF335 are dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Angela M Zavala in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-135, 15CF-32, 15CF-210 and 15CF-121.  
Warrant in 15CF-335.

3:53 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Atty Kryshak is not here.

Court states Atty Kryshak got out late from Marquette County.

Clerk calls Atty Kryshak.
Atty Kryshak is traveling, will be here in about 10 minutes.

Court questions Atty Kryshak.

There is a warrant for Defendant's arrest, in 15CF-335.

Matter will be adjourned until Atty Kryshak arrives.

Defendant Angela M Zavala in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

4:09 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Atty Kryshak has arrived.

This matter was scheduled for a continuing sentencing hearing.
A PSI was completed.
Court reviews file.

Court signed a criminal warrant on September 4th. 

Atty Kryshak addresses the Court, is not ready to go to sentencing. Defendant read part of the PSI. Atty Kryshak addresses the Court regarding day report. 

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, requests bond to be revoked in 15CF-32, or hold an initial appearance on the new file and set a high cash bond.

Court reviews files.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court regarding 15CF-32 and 15CF-121, originally came to a plea agreement, not sure how to proceed.

Parties discuss rescheduling matters.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court regarding15CF-210, there was an initial appearance on this case, was to be a read in.
Atty Kryshak concurs.

15CF-335:
Atty Kryshak has received a copy of the complaint, waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing will be set for 10:30 on September 25th.

State adresses bond in 15CF-335, substantial cash bond unless bond is revoked in 15CF-32.

Atty Kryshak addresses the Court, requests the Court to release his client.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is revoked in 15CF-32 and 15CF-121.
15CF-335: $250 cash bond - comply with conditions set forth in all other bonds  Status conference scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

ADDRESS INFO for Angela M Zavala
Current: 21 County Road ZZ S, Amherst Junction, WI 54407-8817 United States  (Effective: 08-28-2015)
Prior: 21 Cty Tk Zz 18, Amherst Junction, WI 54407

Comply with all conditions set forth in all other cases including defendant report alcohol and drug free to the day report center 3 times per week between now and her sentencing date.   She is to report there today following court.

Defendant Angela M Zavala in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF32, 15CF121, 15CF135 (sentencing) and 15CF210 (Prelim Waiver)
9:07 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Atty Kryshak requests a new sentencing date.  He received the PSI this morning.   
Court reviews the file. 
Court questions Atty Cousins. 
Court questions Atty Kryshak. 
Atty Kryshak makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Cousins makes arguments to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant re: Transportation. 
Defendant responds.  Her boyfriends mother drives her where she needs to go. 
Atty Kryshak makes additional statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Court does not revoke bond today.  Will modify to continue the bonds with the modification that the defendant report alcohol and drug free to the day report center 3 times per week between now and her sentencing date.   She is to report there today following court.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders signature bond in 15CF210 and sets for a status conference.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Angela M Zavala in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF32, 15CF121, 15CF135, 15CF210 (Initial Appearance)
3:46 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed in 15CF32 & 15CF121.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

15CF210 Initial Appearance is conducted: 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.
**The preliminary hearing in this matter will be held at the time of the sentencing hearing.  Per Atty Cousins, if no new charges until the sentencing hearing, this matter will be dismissed/read-in.**
Atty Cousins does not request a bond on this case. 
BY THE COURT:  Defendant is released on her own recognizance. 

15CF32, 15CF121, 15CF135 Plea hearing is conducted:
Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF32 Count 3 - GUILTY
15CF121 Count 1 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF32 Count 3, 15CF121 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Dismissed and read-in are the following: 
15CF32 All remaining counts. 
15CF135 In its entirety.
Court orders PSI and it is to be filed within 60 days. 

Parties are to see the Br 3 Judicial Assistant for a sentencing date. Defendant Angela M Zavala in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
